entries.title: $330,000 to $1.8 million? Video game workers question public salary ranges.
entries.description: Video game studio salaries revealed by a new pay transparency law vary widely, confusing some workers.

entries.title: For a Ukrainian ‘Apex Legends’ pro, war means missed games and heartache
entries.description: The average career of an esports athlete is less than five years. For some Ukrainian pro gamers, dreams of competing onstage again are slowly evaporating.

entries.title: Qualcomm, Iridium will connect more smartphones to satellites this year
entries.description: This year, a new wave of smartphones will feature the ability to send text messages via satellite, and not just for emergencies.

entries.title: Kevin McCarthy’s got problems. The internet’s got jokes.
entries.description: Late-night hosts had a field day as Republican House leader Kevin McCarthy's bid for speaker failed six times. Jon Stewart joked it was C-Span's "best season."

entries.title: Twitter said it fixed ‘verification.’ So I impersonated a senator (again).
entries.description: Elon Musk said Twitter would begin authenticating users who pay $8 for Blue. Our tech columnist was still able to get a checkmark for an impostor Sen. Ed Markey.

entries.title: Influencers outshine traditional media on coverage of FTX implosion
entries.description: A group of online creators has skyrocketed to fame by covering every aspect of the FTX meltdown, but some optimize for attention over accuracy.
